events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their car on the highway causing significant front-end damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on description including vehicle collision and damages.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle this claim to ensure timely communication and processing.
The customer received official acknowledgment of the claim submission with instructions for next steps.
Request was made for the accident report, photos of the vehicle damage, and proof of insurance coverage.
The insured promptly submitted all requested documents including the police report and repair estimates.
Investigation began into the circumstances of the collision and verification of submitted evidence.
The investigation confirmed the insured was not at fault and damage assessments align with the claim.
A settlement offer covering the full estimated repair costs was proposed to the insured for approval.
The insured confirmed acceptance of the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the process.
Based on the acceptance and investigation findings, the claim was formally approved for payment issuance.
The settlement amount was disbursed directly to the insured's designated bank account promptly.
Following payment issuance, the claim file was closed after confirming full resolution with the customer.
Final claim documentation was archived for future reference and compliance with regulatory requirements.
